results.title: Third dimension
results.brief_description: In this survey of modern Canadian sculpture, man’s desire to give a third-dimensional form to his image is seen both in the child’s mudpies and in the greatest commemorative monuments. Techniques of the sculptor’s art - carving in wood and stone, clay modelling, making a plaster mold for metal casting - are demonstrated by leading Canadian sculptors, in a survey which extends from totem poles and early French woodcarving to the great war memorial on Vimy Ridge. Included are Jacobine Jones, Frances Loring, Donald Stewart, Louis Parent and Dora Weschler, as well as Emmanuel Hahn with his designs for coins.

results.title: Third class third rate (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Leonard Lee and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Focus”.
FOCUS investigates the claim that some women in Australia are treated as third class citizens by their husbands. It tells of the life of a migrant woman who made the transition from old world values to modern day society.

results.title: Thinking Small
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Managing the Micro”.
A chance to explore the opportunities which microelectronics offers large, medium and small companies, explaining how the technology differs from earlier technology and what its characteristics are. Case studies include a garment maker, a paper mill, a woodyard and a major manufacturer of tailor-made equipment using computer-aided design and manufacture

results.title: Thinking about drinking
results.brief_description: Presents the facts about alcoholic beverages with emphasis on their effects on the nervous system and behaviour. An alcoholic is a person who drinks so much that it interferes with their work and health, and alcoholism is a disease which constitutes a major health problem.

results.title: Think twice: they're confusing you
results.brief_description: Illustrates kinds of faulty or misleading information, such as oversimplification, distortions of fact, and logical fallacies. Designed to encourage critical thinking about the information which permeates public and personal communication. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Think twice: the persuasion game
results.brief_description: This film presents vignettes which dramatise ways in which the power of persuasion is used to influence the public. Appeals are made to one’s emotions. Fear, vanity, pride, justice and one’s desire to belong are utilised. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.
